DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis: Stimulation of the SPG at high frequencies (50-200Hz) is believed to cause a physiological parasympathetic block which decreases VMCA oxyHb concentration and cephalic vessel diameter. Stimulation of the SPG at low frequencies (1-60 Hz)is believed to cause a physiological parasympathetic upregulation which increases VMCA, oxyHb concentration and cephalic vessel diameter.
DOC.brief_title: Cephalic Vascular Recording Upon SPG Stimulation
DOC.criteria: •Subject is currently enrolled in Pathway CH1 (CIP001) •Subject is NOT currently enrolled in Pathway CH1(CIP001)
